definition: texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up
according to/to act in accordance with/to depend on/to seize/to occupy

sentences.english: The motivation of Chinese words includes sense-symbolic form and intrinsic form.
sentences.chinese: 汉语词的理据包括意味形式和内在形式两大类。

sentences.english: The extensional meaning of compound directional complement has its cognitive basis.
sentences.chinese: 复合趋向补语的引申意义有其认知上的理据。

sentences.english: This definition is well-grounded and rigorous.
sentences.chinese: 这个定义有其充分的理据，而且非常严谨。

sentences.english: Chapter four -the cultural reason of Chinese idioms.
sentences.chinese: 第四章是汉语熟语的文化理据。

sentences.english: Etymon is an important concept in the historical Lexicology.
sentences.chinese: “理据”是历史词汇学的一个重要概念。

sentences.english: Please substantiate your application by providing justifications in the following areas.
sentences.chinese: 请就以下各范畴提出理据以支持贵机构之申请。

sentences.english: The thieves have only themselves to blame behaviour, there is no legal reason according to demand compensation.
sentences.chinese: 小偷只能怪自己行为不检，根本无法律理据要求赔偿。

sentences.english: What are the ethical bases of the anti-globalization movement?
sentences.chinese: 而反全球化运动的道德理据又在那里？

sentences.english: When we think of The Kama Sutra we have to try and understand the reasoning behind it.
sentences.chinese: 当我们想到的卡马经我们要尝试和了解背后的理据。

sentences.english: The former means that the creation and use of linguistic signs have no motivation.
sentences.chinese: 绝对任意是指符号的创造与使用没有任何理据。

sentences.english: The second chapter introduces the constraints of iconicity and cognitive motivation.
sentences.chinese: 第二章介绍了象似性的局限以及认知理据。

sentences.english: Justifications to compulsory donation of fresh organs from a dead person.
sentences.chinese: 强制性遗体器官捐赠的理据。

sentences.english: I cannot legally come up with an argument against same-sex marriage.
sentences.chinese: 我无法举出合法的理据来抵制同性婚姻。

definition: to counter accusations/to protest/to remonstrate/to retort/to plead/to demur/a plea (of not guilty)/a defense (against an allegation)/to enter a plea to a charge (in a law court)
to infer/to consider and come to a judgment/to recommend/to estimate/deduced to be
